summary: Increased globalization and recent economic and financial crises have heightened concerns that U.S. businesses may be at a disadvantage in foreign markets. The departments of State and Commerce play key roles in the U.S. government's efforts to support U.S. businesses abroad. State trains its employees to support U.S. business expansion abroad. However, it doesn't conduct periodic, comprehensive assessments of training needs in this area. Therefore...
title: Economic and Commercial Diplomacy: State and Commerce Implement a Range of Activities, but State Should Enhance Its Training Efforts
